bond:ionic.description_ru: A bond between a metal and a nonmetal through electron transfer. Ions are formed: a cation (+) and an anion (−).
bond:ionic.rule_ru: Δχ ≥ 1.7 or metal + nonmetal with a large electronegativity difference
bond:ionic.properties_ru: High melting points, brittle, conduct electricity in melt and solution

bond:covalent_polar.description_ru: A bond between different nonmetals through shared electron pairs. Electron density is shifted toward the more electronegative atom (δ+, δ−).
bond:covalent_polar.properties_ru: Various melting points, often liquids or gases, do not conduct electricity

bond:covalent_nonpolar.description_ru: A bond between identical nonmetals through shared electron pairs. Electron density is distributed symmetrically.
bond:covalent_nonpolar.properties_ru: Low melting points, gases or low-boiling liquids, do not conduct electricity

bond:metallic.description_ru: A bond in metals: atoms release valence electrons into a shared 'electron cloud' that holds positive ions in the lattice.
bond:metallic.rule_ru: Pure metal or alloy (both are metals)
bond:metallic.properties_ru: Electrical and thermal conductivity, malleability, metallic luster

crystal:ionic.description_ru: At the nodes — alternating cations and anions held together by electrostatic attraction.

crystal:molecular.description_ru: At the nodes — molecules held together by weak intermolecular forces (van der Waals, hydrogen bonds).

crystal:atomic.description_ru: At the nodes — atoms connected by strong covalent bonds throughout the crystal.

crystal:metallic.description_ru: At the nodes — metal ions, between them — free electrons (electron gas).

properties.melting_point_ru: Varies (from −39 °C for Hg to 3422 °C for W)
properties.hardness_ru: Varies (Na is soft, W is hard)
